decks.notes: This deck aims to create explosive plays by combining land ramp with Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor to quickly generate a powerful board presence. With cards like Arboreal Grazer and Green Sun's Zenith to accelerate mana, the deck can search for crucial pieces like Urza's Saga or Boseiju, Who Endures. The key strategy revolves around setting up the combo with Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to create a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Scapeshift and Spelunking to further enhance its versatility and resilience.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and synergies to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By combining a mixture of low-cost artifacts, efficient creatures, and disruptive spells, the deck aims to create a fast and powerful board presence. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and recursion, while cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble help to ramp up resources quickly. The inclusion of powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat allow the deck to deal with threats efficiently while maintaining pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the start. With cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer providing additional value, along with disruption tools like Thraben Charm and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to close out the game quickly and decisively. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison can disrupt the opponent's game plan, giving the aggro player an advantage.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a large number of artifacts and creatures while utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal to generate mana and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt while also maintaining a strong offensive presence with cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Thoughtcast. By deploying efficient threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck can quickly close out games and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful damage-dealing spells. It aims to establish early board presence with creatures like Scion of Draco and Territorial Kavu, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Stubborn Denial and Leyline Binding. The inclusion of powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Lightning Bolt allows the deck to close out the game quickly and decisively. Additionally, the deck utilizes a diverse land base to ensure consistency in mana production and maximize its potential.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in the Boros color combination. It utilizes powerful creatures like Phlage and Ragavan, alongside support from Ajani and Guide of Souls to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment helps to deal with opposing threats. The deck's land base includes fetch lands and utility lands like Arena of Glory to ensure consistency and provide additional advantages. The strategy is to establish early board presence and close out the game swiftly through a combination of creature damage and burn spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of disruption spells and creatures that can interact with the opponent's board. It also aims to apply pressure with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly end the game. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful creatures with unique abilities to gain advantage and control the pace of the game. The mana base is built around fetching necessary colors and fixing mana, allowing the deck to cast its spells reliably and consistently throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Jeskai Ascendancy card to create a powerful combo that allows you to generate infinite mana, draw your entire deck, and ultimately win the game. By playing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to trigger the Ascendancy's abilities, along with Mox Opal and other mana acceleration cards, you can set up a loop of untapping and tapping your creatures to generate mana and spells, allowing you to overwhelm your opponent with an unstoppable combo.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan. The deck also utilizes combo pieces like Malevolent Rumble and Scapeshift to overwhelm the opponent with a big finish. By utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige, the deck aims to consistently assemble the pieces needed for a game-winning combo. The inclusion of lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber allows for additional mana generation and flexibility in playing various important spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes powerful spells like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Galvanic Discharge to control the board and finish off the opponent. With efficient creature removal like Goblin Bombardment and versatile cards like Seasoned Pyromancer, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced aggression while maintaining board control. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison can disrupt the opponent's game plan, giving the deck an edge in aggressive matchups.

Using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents while also disrupting their game plan. By combining powerful creatures like Phage and Ragavan with disruptive cards like Teferi and Strix Serenade, the deck is able to control the board and prevent opponents from executing their own strategies effectively. With a mix of removal spells and protective cards, this deck seeks to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield while also disrupting opponent's plans.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Quantum Riddler to apply pressure while using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to maintain tempo and outmaneuver the opponent. The addition of powerful cards like Solitude and March of Otherworldly Light provides additional versatility and options for dealing with threats. Overall, the deck seeks to quickly establish a dominant position and close out the game before the opponent can recover.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures to disrupt opponent's strategy while taxing their resources. By playing a mix of powerful creatures like Phelia and Phlage, along with disruptive spells like Solitude and Teferi, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and apply pressure on the opponent. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional disruption, while cards like Quantum Riddler and Ragavan help generate value. With a diverse mana base and access to various colors, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly playing and sacrificing artifacts to trigger various effects and get ahead in tempo. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost artifact creatures and utilize cards like Engineered Explosives to control the board. Urza's Saga provides additional artifact creatures and ramp, while Thoughtcast helps with card draw. The deck also includes various artifacts for utility and disruption, such as Tormod's Crypt for graveyard hate and Shadowspear for lifelink and trample. Overall, the deck aims to unleash a fast and aggressive strategy utilizing the synergy of artifacts.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Birthing Ritual to cast powerful Simic creatures and disruptive spells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression while maintaining control through counter spells and creature abilities. By using a mix of efficient creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and versatile spells like Flare of Denial, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Endurance and Subtlety provides additional versatility and protection, making it challenging for the opponent to predict and counter the deck's threats.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with fast, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler. It uses cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and push through damage. Mishra's Bauble provides card advantage and helps enable the deck's prowess triggers. Expressive Iteration and Preordain help smooth out draws and find key cards. The deck also uses land sequencing to maximize tempo and efficiency, with a focus on consistency and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By playing efficient creatures like Doorkeeper Thrull, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Scion of Draco, followed by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly. Utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact and Teferi, Time Raveler for control and protection, this deck aims to secure victory through a combination of aggressive plays and strategic decision-making. Additionally, the inclusion of lands like Arid Mesa and Godless Shrine allows for consistent mana fixing and powerful plays.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and using a mix of powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a variety of colors, the deck can adapt to different situations and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Consign to Memory and Stubborn Denial. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help boost the power of the creature cards in the deck, while cards like Lightning Bolt provide additional damage and removal options. The deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent with a strong attacking force.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and utilizing the unique abilities of Amulet of Vigor to produce an explosive combo with Primeval Titan to search for key lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful land synergies, utilizing cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to control the battlefield while setting up for lethal attacks with Primeval Titan. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, utilizing a mix of combo pieces and utility lands to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Amulet of Vigor combo with Primeval Titan to generate massive amounts of mana and land recursion. Using cards like Arboreal Grazer and various land bounce effects, the deck aims to ramp up mana production and search for key combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, it incorporates tools like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to further enhance the combo potential. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Malevolent Rumble and Aftermath Analyst to control the board and protect the combo.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Ocelot Pride, supported by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Seasoned Pyromancer for additional value and card advantage. With a mix of creature threats, removal spells, and a few disruptive cards like Blood Moon, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast, efficient offense while maintaining some control over the board.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total. Utilizing powerful threats like Ajani and Phlage alongside disruptive elements like Guide of Souls and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to maintain pressure and control the board. The mana base of fetch lands and dual lands ensures consistency in casting spells, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer provide card advantage. The deck also includes versatile spells like Thraben Charm and removal like Path to Exile to deal with threats.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End, while also utilizing artifacts like Blade of the Bloodchief and Sowing Mycospawn to boost creature strength. It also includes disruptive elements like Kozilek's Command and Unholy Heat to control the board. The combination of Eldrazi creatures, artifacts, and disruptive spells creates a versatile and formidable strategy that aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the Broodscale Bloodchief combo, utilizing Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate tokens and power up with Blade of the Bloodchief. Emrakul, the Promised End provides a powerful finisher, while Writhing Chrysalis supports the combo strategy. Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble provide removal and disruption, while Ancient Stirrings helps find key pieces. Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple provide mana acceleration, with support from land cards like Grove of the Burnwillows and Cavern of Souls. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast, aggressive combo strategy.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategies while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Phelia and Phlage to control the board and Quantum Riddler to disrupt the opponent's plans, the deck can slow down the opponent's game plan. Cards like Ragavan, Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, and Consign to Memory provide additional aggression to close out the game quickly. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect the deck's strategy while also providing additional disruption. The deck's mana base is optimized to ensure consistency in casting spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude. It also utilizes instant-speed interaction and card draw to control the game and protect its combo pieces. By combining efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, this deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own combo win condition. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance, while also controlling the board with cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending. It utilizes various combo pieces like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Psychic Frog, and Quantum Riddler to create dominant board states. The inclusion of cards like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending provide sustainability and card advantage, allowing the deck to consistently pull off its combo win conditions. Teferi, Time Raveler also helps protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and then bringing them back into play with cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. Using cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan while setting up the combo. The deck also includes protection like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The land base is designed to provide the necessary color mana sources for casting spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Phelia and Phage while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Ragavan. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Prismatic Ending and board wipes like March of Otherworldly Light. Teferi, Time Raveler is included to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and includes powerful lands like Arid Mesa and Flooded Strand. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and disrupt the opponent's plans to secure victory.

This deck focuses on the aggressive playstyle of Affinity, utilizing artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, the deck can generate mana efficiently and play multiple threats in a single turn. Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt provide disruption against opposing strategies, while Thoughtcast helps maintain card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Aether Spellbomb and Shadowspear offer additional utility and ways to push through damage. Overall, this deck aims to deploy threats quickly and keep the pressure on the opponent to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to play aggressively, using low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage quickly. Cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter can provide additional damage or disruption. The deck includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to remove opposing threats and finish off opponents. Mishra's Bauble and Preordain help with card selection and drawing into needed spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal spells.

Utilize a variety of creatures with synergistic abilities to assemble powerful combos and outvalue opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format. Leveraging cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Malevolent Rumble, generate incremental advantage and disrupt opponents' strategies. Utilize creatures like Walking Ballista and Young Wolf to control the board and pressure opponents. Use cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Vexing Bauble to generate card advantage and create favorable exchanges. With a diverse toolbox of creatures and powerful combo potential, overwhelm opponents and secure victory through efficient and flexible play.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. The deck aims to win the game quickly by attacking with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to support the aggro strategy by providing additional damage and control options. The inclusion of versatile cards like Lightning Bolt and Teferi, Time Raveler helps to give the deck flexibility in dealing with various threats and maintaining the pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using powerful spells like Lightning Bolt to control the board and deal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Leyline cards to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of evasive threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and strong removal spells like Winternight Stories, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory. Additionally, the inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler provides extra utility and disruption options to outmaneuver the opponent.

The strategy of this deck revolves around using cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to quickly ramp into powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. Planar Genesis helps to generate additional mana to fuel the combo, while Veil of Summer protects your creatures and spells from disruption. The deck also includes some utility cards like Pact of Negation and Repudiate / Replicate to counter opposing strategies. By efficiently assembling your combo pieces and creatures, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive plays and fast ramping. The deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo by using cards like Summoner's Pact and Primeval Titan to search for key pieces. The deck also includes land manipulation cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Urza's Saga to further accelerate ramping. Overall, the deck uses a combination of ramp, card advantage, and land manipulation to quickly and consistently bring out powerful threats and win the game.

The deck revolves around utilizing Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp up mana, allowing Primeval Titan to search out key lands and combo pieces. The deck focuses on playing multiple lands per turn, generating mana to cast spells and trigger abilities. The goal is to assemble the combo of Amulet Titan, which can generate overwhelming board presence and potentially win the game in a single turn. The deck includes various utility lands and spells to support the combo strategy, while also providing alternate win conditions through cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble.

The deck revolves around the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate explosive mana ramp and land searching capabilities. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer, Urza's Saga, and Lotus Field, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Aftermath Analyst provides alternative win conditions and ways to close out the game. With careful sequencing and thoughtful decision-making, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful spells and creatures, especially Primeval Titan. It utilizes cards like Amulet of Vigor and Malevolent Rumble to generate mana and create powerful combos. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and Urza's Saga to search for key pieces and outvalue opponents. The mix of lands and tutor cards like Green Sun's Zenith allows for flexible gameplay and the ability to adapt to different matchups. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble powerful combinations to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal quick damage to the opponent. With cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer, the deck can maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent's resources. The inclusion of removal spells like Solitude and Galvanic Discharge helps control the board, while cards like Ocelot Pride and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and allow for the deck to curve out smoothly and apply pressure early on.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on a strong early game aggression with low mana cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes some control elements such as removal spells and disruption to maintain board control. Key cards like Ajani, Ragavan, and Seasoned Pyromancer help to generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Voice of Victory provide additional reach and finishing power to close out games quickly. The deck aims to end the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly with creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. Utilizing disruptive spells like Galvanic Discharge and Redirect Lightning, along with cards like Blood Moon to slow down opponents. The deck aims to finish off the opponent with burst damage from cards like Ocelot Pride and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Additionally, cards like Voice of Victory and Arena of Glory provide additional support to the aggressive game plan, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play creatures and spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It combines a mix of powerful creatures like Ajani and Ragavan with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off the opponent. The addition of cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison help disrupt the opponent's strategy while the mana base allows for consistent access to all the necessary colors of mana. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and removal spells.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful enchantments, while utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to generate card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of cards like Voice of Victory and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional ways to close out games quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly apply pressure, while also controlling the board with cards like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, this deck aims to close out games quickly. Cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ocelot Pride provide card advantage and additional threats. The inclusion of Blood Moon and Static Prison can disrupt opponents' game plans, giving this deck a versatile approach to securing victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to play efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer alongside powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also includes Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional creature support and utility. The burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment help to clear the way for attacks while the enchantments like Ocelot Pride and Voice of Victory provide additional ways to boost your creatures' power. Overall, the deck aims to win the game swiftly through a combination of creature aggression and direct damage.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro Modern deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while utilizing powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ocelot Pride to deal massive damage. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board, as well as versatile options like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison help disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the deck to push for victory efficiently.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate massive amounts of mana and create a lethal board state. The deck also includes cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista for additional threats and win conditions. Supporting cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Kozilek's Command help in maintaining board presence and disrupting opponents. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings aids in searching for key combo pieces, while lands like Grove of the Burnwillows and Eldrazi Temple provide mana acceleration.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize the Broodscale Bloodchief combo to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck focuses on generating mana with cards like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple, while also using Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble for disruption. The inclusion of cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Vexing Bauble allows for additional synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and efficient combos.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while also quickly putting pressure on them. By utilizing powerful creatures like Phelia and Phlage, as well as disruptive spells like Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and quickly close out the game. Additionally, cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide additional disruption and protection for your own creatures. This deck is designed to be fast-paced and proactive, forcing the opponent to react to your threats while you establish control of the board.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the game by managing the opponent's resources, while gradually building card advantage with card draw and filtering effects. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent provides a win condition, while cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler offer additional card advantage and utility. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with Eldrazi creatures and using control spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to accelerate into powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End while also dealing with threats through removal spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The deck also leverages mana acceleration with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast expensive spells ahead of curve. Overall, the strategy revolves around ramping into Eldrazi creatures and controlling the board to dominate the late game.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with a mix of powerful control elements and efficient creatures, while also applying pressure with aggressive threats. The goal is to control the board through removal spells and disruptive creatures like Teferi, Time Raveler, while also presenting a clock with efficient beaters like Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying enough pressure to close out the game quickly before they can recover.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand, then bringing them back onto the battlefield using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. The deck includes disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces. The key strategy is to reanimate creatures at instant speed to surprise the opponent and overwhelm them with powerful threats. The deck also includes some removal spells and card draw to maintain control of the game while setting up the combo.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes a mix of control spells and efficient creatures to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory provide removal options, while Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer fast, evasive threats. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck is designed to outpace opponents with its aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately overwhelming them to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's strategy while using powerful creatures like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly close out the game. Utilizing a combination of removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, along with disruptive creatures like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, the deck aims to control the game state and pressure the opponent. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection for the deck's game plan, allowing for tempo swings in your favor. Wrath of the Skies and Consign to Memory help to clear the board and push through for lethal damage.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with disruptive spells to control the game tempo. Phelia and Phlage provide powerful threats while Quantum Riddler and Solitude offer removal options. Ragavan helps generate card advantage and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can disrupt opponent's strategies. Consign to Memory can provide flexibility in dealing with threats. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to control the board and disrupt opponent's plays. The mana base is designed to support the deck's casting requirements, with a mix of fetch lands and utility lands. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of counterspells, disruptive spells, and combo pieces to control the game until you can assemble your combo win condition using Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to your opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing cards that allow you to manipulate the stack and protect your key pieces, all while having access to a toolbox of spells to handle different situations. The lack of lands in the deck allows for a more streamlined approach to quickly assembling your combo and closing out the game.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost artifact creatures and utilizing cards that benefit from having artifacts on the battlefield. The strategy involves quickly building up a board presence with cheap creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary, as well as generating card advantage with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thoughtcast. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke to control the game while pressuring the opponent's life total. Urza's Saga is a key card in the deck, allowing for the tutor and creation of powerful artifacts to further strengthen the aggressive strategy.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate mana through various rituals and medallions, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn. By chaining together spells and utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to copy instants or sorceries, the deck aims to create a storm count high enough to finish off the opponent with a massive Grapeshot. The inclusion of Past in Flames allows for the player to potentially recast key spells from the graveyard, providing additional reach and flexibility in executing the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual and utilizing a mix of creatures with flash and disruptive spells to control the game. The goal is to drop threats like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl while countering opponent's plays with cards like Subtlety and Flare of Denial. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient card advantage and tempo plays, utilizing the Simic color combination to create a versatile and powerful aggro strategy.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Birthing Ritual and utilize disruptive creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Quantum Riddler to control the board while dealing damage. Coiling Oracle and Shardless Agent provide card advantage, while Ice-Fang Coatl offers additional control options. Sink into Stupor and Flare of Denial help to disrupt the opponent's plays, with backup from Dismember and Force of Negation. The inclusion of Subtlety and Endurance provides additional disruption and protection. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and control.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to set up their own game plan. By using a combination of efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to help dig for additional threats and keep the pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to allow for consistent access to all three colors in order to cast the deck's spells effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off, while supporting them with spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Mutagenic Growth to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help with card advantage and setting up future turns, while Cori-Steel Cutter and Violent Urge provide additional creatures and combat tricks. The mana base is optimized for quick and efficient casting of spells and creatures to overwhelm the opponent as quickly as possible.
